leadingComments.value:
*
 * PlaylistLoader - delegate for media manifest/playlist loading tasks. Takes care of parsing media to internal data-models.
 *
 * Once loaded, dispatches events with parsed data-models of manifest/levels/audio/subtitle tracks.
 *
 * Uses loader(s) set in config to do actual internal loading of resource tasks.
 *
 * @module
 *

trailingComments.value: responseURL not supported on some browsers (it is used to detect URL redirection)
data-uri mode also not supported (but no need to detect redirection)

trailingComments.value: if no embedded audio track defined, but audio codec signaled in quality level,
we need to signal this main audio track this could happen with playlists with
alt audio rendition in which quality levels (main)
contains both audio+video. but with mixed audio track not signaled

leadingComments.value: check if we have found an audio track embedded in main playlist (audio track without URI attribute)

trailingComments.value: We have done our first request (Manifest-type) and receive
not a master playlist but a chunk-list (track/level)
We fire the manifest-loaded event anyway with the parsed level-details
by creating a single-level structure for it.

comments.value:
*
 * PlaylistLoader - delegate for media manifest/playlist loading tasks. Takes care of parsing media to internal data-models.
 *
 * Once loaded, dispatches events with parsed data-models of manifest/levels/audio/subtitle tracks.
 *
 * Uses loader(s) set in config to do actual internal loading of resource tasks.
 *
 * @module
 *
responseURL not supported on some browsers (it is used to detect URL redirection)
data-uri mode also not supported (but no need to detect redirection)

*
     * @desc
     * Returns defaults or configured loader-type overloads (pLoader and loader config params)
     * @lineNumber
     * 102
     * @param
     * {PlaylistLoaderContext} context
     * @return
     * {Loader}

*
     * @desc
     * Call `destroy` on all internal loader instances mapped (one per context type)
     * @lineNumber
     * 133
logger.debug(`[playlist-loader]: Loading playlist of type ${context.type}, level: ${context.level}, id: ${context.id}`);
Check if a loader for this context already exists
apply different configs for retries depending on
Override level/track timeout for LL-HLS requests
(the default of 10000ms is counter productive to blocking playlist reload requests)
logger.debug(`[playlist-loader]: Calling internal loader delegate for URL: ${context.url}`);
Validate if it is an M3U8 at all
Check if chunk-list or master. handle empty chunk list case (first EXTINF not signaled, but TARGETDURATION present)
multi level playlist, parse level info
check if we have found an audio track embedded in main playlist (audio track without URI attribute)
if no embedded audio track defined, but audio codec signaled in quality level,
we need to signal this main audio track this could happen with playlists with
alt audio rendition in which quality levels (main)
contains both audio+video. but with mixed audio track not signaled
We have done our first request (Manifest-type) and receive
not a master playlist but a chunk-list (track/level)
We fire the manifest-loaded event anyway with the parsed level-details
by creating a single-level structure for it.
extend the context with the new levelDetails property
